poem:
### Ultimatum

In the echo of declarations,  
"Three or four days," he says—a negotiation  
held in the rapid tick of a second hand,  
where walls crumble and rebuild in the breath between words.  
Time, a vague promise wading through dust.  
Futures hang on syllables,  
and somewhere, the clock whispers a countdown  
only the sky can hear.
